channel.title: Help Please, Virus, Urgent help
channel.description:
Just recently I done a virus scan, These things came up
[img]http://img301.imageshack.us/img301/9223/helppleasezf3.png[/img]
But the weird thing is there are no signs of these exsisting. My computer is working fine but I want to get rid of these.
What would be the best way to do that? I use AVG so should I follow the path to it and delete them?Put in virus vault? Or any other suggestions? Please help me ASAP.
Thanks
Just now something else came up
[img]http://img132.imageshack.us/img132/6947/helpagainqk5.png[/img]

item.title: Help Please, Virus, Urgent help
item.dc:creator: @nicodk nicodk
item.description:
@nicodk wrote:

i-worm uhh thats a bad one. i removed it for my friend with ad-awave scans and avg scans.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Please, Virus, Urgent help
item.dc:creator: @wonko wonko
item.description:
@wonko wrote:

Do you have hidden folders enabled?

Read full topic

item.title: Help Please, Virus, Urgent help
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

Ok, for the one labeled "install[1].htm. That one was just recently download from the web, or it was downloaded before. You must have went on a website, and it downloaded the file to your computer. To get rid of that, you need to clear your cache, cookies, etcâ€¦

The other ones should be removed by your antivirus software.

Read full topic
